comments.text:
Followup to bug 543463.

It would be cleaner if the packaged version of the js shell was just a single binary the user can throw in their $HOME/bin. They can throw the libs in there too I guess, but then those just get intermingled with whatever else is in there, and if they want to move it they have to identify and move the libs too.

Followup to bug 543463.

It would be cleaner if the packaged version of the js shell was just a single binary the user can throw in their $HOME/bin. They can throw the libs in there too I guess, but then those just get intermingled with whatever else is in there, and if they want to move it they have to identify and move the libs too.
I don't know if there's a straightforward way to do this, FWIW.
